column2: carolinagirl, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Caregiver)
column9: For years my father used Goodys and eventually was taking several per day. He was hospitalized for fluid buildup and was recovering well after a week of treatment.  Then out of nowhere he started losing blood.  He had developed a stomach bleed. He passed away because they could not regulate his blood clotting ability in order to stop the stomach bleed.A physician at the hospital told me this was a very common problem with people who use  these headache/body ache powders...that they should have been taken off the market years and years ago.  If you or someonee you love uses these, please find another pain reliever. I asked my Daddy for years to stop using them, but I believe he was addicted to them either physically or mentally and they ate away his stomach lining.  The damage done is real according to a doctor.  I believe it.

column2: jackieseals, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I'm sure this post may seem confusing.  I rated the effectiveness as 5 stars and satisfaction as 2 stars???  Goody Powders are VERY effective in relieving headache pain, however...They are also very addictive.  Until 3 months ago, I had been using Goodys for over 10 years. At first, 1 powder every now and then would take care of the problem.  Then it was 1 powder twice a day.  Then 3 times a day.  When I kicked the Goody Powder habit, I was taking 2 powders at one time 6 or more times a day.  My doctor had asked me before to give them up because they were actually causing the majority of my headaches. This is called Rebound Headaches. Your body becomes addicted to the caffiene (32.5 mg ea.) and aspirin (520 mg. ea.) in the powders so after a while you have to use a larger quantity to stop the headaches you are having from your body's cravings.  Not to mention what all the aspirin and acetaminophen (260 mg ea.)is doing to your liver. He even offered to prescribe steroids to help me kick the habit.  Instead, I went "cold turkey".  The headaches & body aches for the first 2 weeks were very bad.  The 3rd week was rough but not as tough as the first two.  Now I RARELY have a headache.  And I do not reach for a powder if I do have one.  Aleve works well for me now.  Please do not make the misconception that if you are not popping as many powders as I was, you don't have a "problem".  The sooner you stop taking them the better off you will be.  Even if you have to turn to your doctor for assistance.
